attributes.action: Discriminating disabled adults to get jobs.
attributes.additional_details: I went for an interview one time at a pub and the manager told me I would be taking plates out to peoples table and I told the manager that I could carry only one plate out at a time as I have limited use of my right arm. And that he was worried that I couldn’t do it as I would have to carry 2 to 3 plates at a time.
attributes.background: To make sure employees decide not to hire people who have a disability.

rejection.details:
against the law for employers to discriminate against you because of a disability. The Equality Act 2010 protects you and covers areas including:

- application forms
- interview arrangements
- aptitude or proficiency tests
- job offers
- terms of employment, including pay
- promotion, transfer and training opportunities
- dismissal or redundancy
- discipline and grievances

You can find out more about disability rights in employment here: https://www.gov.uk/rights-disabled-person/employment

If you think you have been discriminated against, you can find sources of advice and information here: https://www.gov.uk/rights-disabled-person/further-help-and-advice
